feed.title: Category: picks | User group for Viennese rubyists

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
12/10 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the eighty-fourth edition:

Laura:
  • 24 Pull Requests - Giving back little gifts of code for Christmas
  • Uncss - Remove all those unused styles from your css!
  • Regex Crosswords - Show off those Regex skills you got
Floor:
  • Rails Girls Brno - they shot this video during their November edition and it’s <3
  • BentoBox app - Nur Sah Ketene made this super useful resource for future Rails Girls workshops (or generally beginner workshops)
  • Foodhack Vienna - Aaron Cruz already introduced it during our last meetup: you can now help Austria eliminate food waste

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
12/03 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the eighty-third edition:

Laura:
  • CLI GitHub - A fancy GitHub client for command line
  • Dokku - Your own mini-Heroku, in under five minutes
Floor:
  • CSS3 animation cheat sheet - a great set of preset, plug-and-play animations for your web projects.
  • git extras - adding more git utilities to your toolbelt

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
11/26 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the eighty-second edition:

Laura:
  • Yosemite San Francisco - Replace Helvetica Neue on your 10.10 Yosemite with the beautiful San Francisco Display (the Apple Watch font)
  • Automate all the things - Because we just can’t get enough of rake
  • Hacksummit - A virtual conference for developers
Ben:
  • Ruby Raptor - Phusion Passenger 5 (beta 1) got released!
  • Ruby DSLs - Writing DSL’s in Ruby without Monkeypatching
Floor:
  • Build a mini chat app - … with Rails and HTML5 server-sent events
  • The Future of the Web - … according to Google
  • Task lists - Github open sourced their task list components

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
11/19 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the eighty-first edition:

Laura:
  • Access Granted - Multi-role authorisation gem for Rails
  • Building a Ruby List Comprehension -..or attempting to. An interesting read by Ben Lewis
  • RubyGems - Believe it or not, RubyGems got a redesign - and it’s gorgeous
Floor:
  • Thinking for programmers - a great talk by Leslie Lamport, as recommended by Phillipp Röll (@phillipp)
  • 7 habits of highly effective web developers - … for you to repeat to yourself in the mirror

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
11/12 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the eightieth edition:

Laura:
  • Rails Rumble Gem Teardown 2014 - Spying on which gems were the most likeable in this year’s Rails Rumble projects
  • Readme.io - Beautiful documentation made easy. (And also because I like their login form animation when you click on the password field)
Ben:
  • Data Import - sequel based dsl to migrate data from a legacy database to a new home.
  • RubyRaptor - Insights into making the new Ruby Raptor Application Server faster than everything else
Floor:
  • tdver - test-driven versioning - keeping an eye on this
  • jQuery update - it’s on its way, prepare for appocalipse (pun intended)
  • Hello Swift - Creating a ‘Hello World’ app with Swift
  • HTML5 - Now that HTML5 is a W3 recommendation - one better starts reading up on the phenomenon
